intro: Xyris restiacea, commonly known as the swamp lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the genus Xyris, which includes several species of herbaceous plants commonly found in wetland environments. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swamps, marshes, and along the edges of ponds. Xyris restiacea is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
